title: The location is perfect,the service is excellent and the staff are very helpful.

text: Excellent location next to 101 building, great gym and spa, very comfortable rooms, great variety of food for breakfast. Perfect.,,

We booked a Triple room city view inclusive of breakfast. We were lucky to be upgraded to a family suite with a large room, sitting area, two toilets.It was so spacious and felt at home. We had lovely city view on one side and 101 on the other side. Lovely.,,No complains,,
The breakfast spread was amazing. Extremely polite and friendly staff.,,

Very nice hotel. Excellent location - shops, restaurants, night markets, subway, etc. Good breakfast, large swimming pool with a good view of the city.,,The room had a low ceiling, I could easily reach the ceiling with my hand.One day there was a large queue of about 30 people for breakfast.,,
Location And the Bed comfort.,,Poor room ventilation, smiley bathroom. Contact front desk to solve the issue. Action taken but no result. Bad experience.,,

- Spacious, clean room and bathroom
- Staff extremely friendly and helpful no matter the hour of day or night
- Plenty of restaurants inside the hotel if you prefer to eat in
- Right next to Taipei 101 tower
- Situated in lively new Taipei
- Had my birthday during my stay and they brought me a nice birthday cake as a surprise... Details count ;),,

Clean room, central location (steps to subway station, and air walkway to Taipei 101), nicely decorated guest room and hotel lobby are all well within expectation.  What really impressed me is the amenities available to hotel guest which include a decent size of 24 hour gym, group classes, outdoor heated pool (I didn't use it while I was there but it looked really nice), and spa facility (including sauna, hot and cold tubs). Once I discovered the spa facility which is available to all hotel guests without a spa treatment, I went almost everyday after workout.,,USB plug charging, and it would be great if smart tv function is available (i.e. apps for connecting to Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc.) as I don't really watch cable tv.,,

Very friendly and helpful staff
Very good facilities in room,,Not enough suitable space for opening two luggage together,,
Great location!,,The bedding was a bit disappointing, compared to the other Hyatts. The sheets kept coming off.,,
Because itâ€™s not care about the customers,,

The grand reception area. The Housekeeping ensure we have sufficient shampoo and bath soap to use daily. Unlike other 5 star hotels, they did not replenish even when it runs Low. It is just beside Taipei 101, great location. They even provide the kidâ€™s slipper and cup for brushing teeths.,,They did not offer fruits throughout our stays. Upon check out, when I asked them why, then only they told me fruits is upon request and it is free. They should have told me upon check in. Other 5 star hotels I stayed replenish the fruits daily without request.,,
Love the location and staff are overall friendly,,

Location,,Light fixtures were not working on the control next to one of the beds in room 1045 and one of the reading lights was burnt out.Curtains in 1045 was a hassle to manually pull up and didnâ€™t keep light out that well.Breakfast buffet on Sunday morning was chaotic and food quality was average,,

Clean, good location, great staff, and a lot of facilities including big swimming pool..,,,Club floor is a joke. 
I visited club floor on 3 times every time same result. Nothing to snack on due to the fact I missed the short service window.
Suggest to prolong service hours and at least offer a small snack for people who has other things to do then to keep track of when club floor is operating...
On the rare occasions the club floor is operating the choice of snacks and breakfast are mediocre for a 5 star hotel in this category... 
So with the short time the club floor is actually operational and mediocre snacks and breakfast. I really suggest guests to look for other options. This is a waste of time.,,

I had an overall fantastic stay in Grand Hyatt Taipei, however, one thing to note is the quality of its pillow. I expect a much better sleeping experience at a five star hotel, but the pillow were not great at all, and the the door wasn't as soundproof as I'd expect on a Hyatt establishment. Location is amazing, walking distance to Taipei 101 and I don't have to worry if Taipei happened to rain all day, indoor food and shop just a stone throw away!,,The pillow quality was not up to my standard, and the fact that the hotel door wasn't as soundproof as I would've expect.,,

the rooms were very clean.  staff were polite and it is within walking distance to the 101 and Mitsukoshi malls if you are into shopping.,,check in was incredibly long at more than 20 minutes in the queue.  the front desk girls seem to be registering guests very slowly.  even the European gentlemen in front of me remarked this is not a 5-star hotel standard......,,

The hotel held 2000euros on my credit card as guarantee, its been 14 working days and I have not received my deposit yet. The hotel bill was settled in full during checkout but the hotel wonâ€™t return the deposit. Very bad practice.,,

Location was perfect for getting around the city - we were going for a few nights and mostly to just walk around, eat great food and check out the shops.The hotel itself has a nice lobby area. We didn't eat at the restaurants so can't comment on it. Forgot our swimming gear so didn't get to test out the pool!The room was a decent size and I liked the big comfy bed as well as a big rainfall shower in the bathroom.The staff was the highlight - we always felt looked after and always warmly greeted. It made us feel very comfortable and I have no doubt recommending the hotel on this basis alone. I appreciated the addition of the bolster for my pregnant partner and the staff for managing to find my camera lens that I stupidly left it in the room after checking out.,,While the room size was good, it felt a bit tired and lacking in what I would expect of a 5-star hotel. The TV was old and would cut in and out. The plug sockets were in fairly inconvenient locations for charging phones and other electronic devices. The bathroom wasn't as clean as I'd expect and we came back to find that glasses were still remaining with dregs of drinks left inside. For the price per night, I'd want to be excited to be in the room and I wasn't.,,
I really loved the view and the room. Location was also really great.,,
Excellent location close to 101 and shopping. Hotel offers best service, breakfast really good with lots of tasty varieties.,,
the location was really good and the staff was really friendly,,

The Staff are not very professional.  My friends delivered some gift bag for me before my check in.  When I checked in the hotel, I asked about the gift bag and was told that it was already delivered to my room.  But, when I entered the room, there is nothing there.  I called the front desk right away,  and they could not tell me where the gift was placed.  Until the next morning before I check out, they found the gift bag.  Also, when I checked in, the staff was not very friendly.,,

I booked this lovely hotel for a 3 day-stop-over in Taipei for my son & his friend ( both 18 years ) on their way to Australia.
The communication upfront with the hotel was very good & professionell.
The 2 boys really enjoyed Taipei and their stay Grand Hyatt Taipei.
They had a lovely room with a nice view, they enjoyed the gym, the pool and the breakfast.
They said that the area is perfect to discover beautiful Taipei, very close to Taipei 101 and the shops, aa well as plenty nice restaurants.
Good place to discover Taipei with the public transport as well.
Thanks for making this Stop-Over for my son & his friend a really nice start of their 6 month trip!,,The only thing the boys would mentioned to be improved was the temperature of the lovely outdoor swimming pool.,,

The location right next to 101 was great,,,The room looks dated and old,
